column5: I just returned last Sunday from Lac Evans in northern Quebec and can honestly say as a confirmed big pike nut this lake and its fishery blew me away! We caught a LOT of large fish!Walleye were prolific and almost everywhere on the lake, although generally on the smaller side. We barely fished for them.My nine year old son Brendan was my boat partner on this trip and I know it's one he will never forget. Besides all the big fish he caught, something happened that I'll refer to here as simply "the incident". You'll have to read the story to find out what happened, but needless to say it involved a true test of endurance and good dose of true grit. For anyone who's interested you can see the full story here, as always with lots of photos and video clips!Cheers, Mike http://www.canadafishingguide.net/gi...he-lowlands-2/
Great report Mike. I've never seen so many trophy pike from one trip. Thanks for sharing.
Thanks! And yeah, considering the time of year the numbers were good. I usually only catch numbers like that early in the season.
Beautiful fish! Two of them looked to be an unusual color phase. Is that common in Quebec?

as always great report. glad u had a great experience on a lake ive been fishing since '98. love to see what you could do earlier in the season. as ive always said, I truly believe its and exceptional fishery, with catch and release on all northerns, not only great numbers but true monsters!!!! love this lake

Yes indeed! Evans is renowned for having good numbers of silver pike. Pretty cool reall!Quote: Originally Posted by spurs101Great report....incredible really.Thank you!Quote: Originally Posted by deputy dogas always great report. glad u had a great experience on a lake ive been fishing since '98. love to see what you could do earlier in the season. as ive always said, I truly believe its and exceptional fishery, with catch and release on all northerns, not only great numbers but true monsters!!!!love this lakeThanks bud, you of all people can appreciate how awesome the lake is!
Great report as always. Looks like quite the adventure, the pike are amazing.
Great story Mike. Although I figured you would have been trolling a crank or something during your paddling extravaganza!! Good times and thanks for sharing.
